key_risks: Regulatory and compliance risks due to operating in highly regulated markets
Market volatility and exposure to economic and political instability in Asia and Africa
Pandemic-related uncertainties impacting claims and sales
Reputational risks from past mis-selling scandals
Intense competitive pressures in key markets
controversies: £23.9 million fine from the UK’s Financial Conduct Authority for mis-selling annuities
environmental_issues: Commitment to achieving net-zero carbon emissions by 2050, requiring significant investment
social_issues: Impact of COVID-19 on claims and sales, particularly in Asia
Reputational damage from mis-selling scandals affecting customer trust
governance_issues: Regulatory scrutiny and compliance risks in key markets
Potential pressure from institutional investors due to share price declines

sources.title: Prudential pivots to Asia just as regional storm clouds gather
sources.snippet: Prudential first signalled plans to focus on Asia under former chief executive Tidjane Thiam. It listed its shares in 2010 in Hong Kong and Singapore to help fund a $35bn attempt to take over AIA.

sources.title: FCA fines Prudential £23,875,000 for failures relating to non-advised ...
sources.snippet: The Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) has today fined The Prudential Assurance Company Limited (Prudential) £23,875,000 for failures related to non-advised sales of annuities. Between July 2008 and September 2017, Prudential's non-advised annuity business focused on selling annuities directly to existing Prudential pension holders.
